bibl.title: Letter from George Miller Sternberg to Aristides Agramonte, May 10, 1901

div1.p: Sternberg requests personal information from Agramonte, which Agramonte supplies on the lower half of the page before he returns the letter to Sternberg.

div1.head: Letter from George Miller Sternberg to Aristides Agramonte, May 10, 1901
div1.opener:
War Department,
SURGEON GENERAL'S OFFICE,
Washington, MAY 10 1901
Dr. Aristides Agramonte,
Contract Surgeon, U.S. Army.
Sir:
div1.p:
Information as to certain facts of your personal history being
desired to complete your record at this office, you are requested to
make answer to the appended questions and return this paper to this
office as early as practicable.
div1.closer:
Very respectfully, G. M. Sternberg Surgeon General, U. S. Army.
Place of birth? Puerto Principe, Cuba.
Date of birth? June 3rd 1868.
At what college and in what year were you graduated in medicine?
College of Physicians & Surgeons, Med. Dept. Columbia Col-
lege - June 8th. 1892
University of Havana, Aug. 2d. 1900.--
Have you been in the military or naval service of the United States
prior to service under present contract? (Give dates and nature of
service.) In military service from May 2d. 1898
to date
Permanent residence? (Give street and number in large city.)
#144 Co. 79th Street, New York City.--
Nearest of kin, or friend, who may be commùnicated with in case of
emergency?
Name: Mrs. A. Agramonte
Address: 144 Co. 79th Street, New York.
Relationship: Wife
Aristides Agramonte
Contract Surgeon U. S. A.
